title: no-restricted-globals doesn't allow self in service worker envs
body:
Upgrading to `eslint-config-airbnb` broke my service worker linting and the fix is not clear.

Inside a service worker, `self` is a global variable referring to the `ServiceWorkerGlobalScope` and is the standard method for setting event listeners. However, the new `no-restricted-globals` rule disallows the use of `self`, even if the top of the file includes `/* global self */`.

One possible solution to the problem would be to set `const self = this` explicitly on top of the file, but this poses an issue with es modules, where you cannot have `this` on the global context, and bundlers like `rollup` actually rewrite `this` as `undefined`.

Maybe removing `self` as a restricted global would be the way to go, or maybe the restricted globals should depend on the environment itself...

title: Fix confusing method name in Classes & Constructor
body:
Why? The method in the current example is called `pop()` but it actually implements an [Array.prototype.shift()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/shift) method which is confusing for no good reason. It just does it on the wrong side of an array.

I understand the change clutters the example code a bit, but at least it's less confusing.

Another approach--probably a better one--would be to change the name of the method from `pop` to `dequeue` leaving the implementation as is. The `peek` name and implementation could be left as is too then.

title: [guide] Use HTTPS for links to ESLint documentation
body:
The result of a `s_http://eslint\.org_https://eslint\.org_g`.

Avoids the HTTP 301s of the non-HTTPS URLs.

title: flycheck issues ecmaFeatures deprecated error at every change when loading airbnb with "extends" property
body:
I reported this issue initially here: https://github.com/flycheck/flycheck/issues/1350 and received the following advice and am forwarding this:

> The problem is exit code 1 that comes from xml parser. eslint will print deprecation warning before actual XML output. Right now flycheck does not distinguish strout and stderr so everything that we get from eslint we feed to XML parser. My understanding is that changing this will also have implications to other parsers in flycheck. See GH-1323.
> 
> Easy solution is to take airbrb config and paste it in your .eslintrc file and than remove ecmaFeatures from config. You can run eslint --print-config . to get resolved config without any extends.
> 
> You can also try to downgrade eslint to a version that does not have ecmaFeatures deprecated until that ruleset gets removed from airbrb eslint config.
> 
> You should let airbnb plugin maintainers know that ecmaFeatures is deprecated and should be removed.
> 
> Long term solution is to modify flycheck to parse JSON output from eslint instead of XML. That way we can use flycheck-parse-json to remove all non JSON data (all deprecation warnings).

title: Error: configuration for rule "arrow-body-style" is invalid
body:
My linter dependencies are the following (the latest from each package):

```json
"devDependencies": {
  "eslint": "4.9.0",
  "eslint-config-airbnb": "15.1.0",
  "eslint-plugin-import": "2.8.0",
  "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "6.0.2",
  "eslint-plugin-react": "7.4.0"
}
```

On Atom (the latest, 1.21.1 x64), MacOS, there is the following error and the linters don't work:

```bash
/Users/my-user/my-project/node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/es6.js:
	Configuration for rule "arrow-body-style" is invalid:
	Value "as-needed,[object Object]" has more items than allowed.

Referenced from: /Users/my-user/my-project/node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb-base/index.js
Referenced from: airbnb
Referenced from: /Users/my-user/my-project/.eslintrc Error: /Users/my-user/my-project/node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/es6.js:
	Configuration for rule "arrow-body-style" is invalid:
	Value "as-needed,[object Object]" has more items than allowed.

Referenced from: /Users/my-user/my-project/node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb-base/index.js
Referenced from: airbnb
Referenced from: /Users/my-user/my-project/.eslintrc
```

Does anybody have the same issue or any idea how I can resolve it?

I tried to completely disable the "arrow-body-style" rule from my `.eslintrc`, but still the error appears and the linters don't work:

```
{
    "extends": "airbnb",
    "rules": {
        "arrow-body-style": 0
    },
    "parser": "babel-eslint"
}
```

title: Initialize some property for each object in a list
body:
I want to do this
this.someList.forEach(item => item.someProperty = 'Some Value');

But i get these
no-return-assign   Arrow function should not return assignment
no-param-reassign  Assignment to property of function parameter 'item'

How do i do it diffrently?

title: [doc] Fix a numeration typo in README.md
Add symbol to list of primitives
Changes the eslint `no-mixed-operators` rule to only warn on mixing `**` and `%` with arithmetic operators
Fix markdown style breaking
body:
It came from the special characters "M-BM-":

``` bash
diff README.md README.md.new | cat -A
651c651$
<     const foo = function uniqueMoreDescriptiveLexicalFoo() {$
---$
>  M-BM-  M-BM- const short = function longUniqueMoreDescriptiveLexicalFoo() {$
```

title: Add AngularJS section
body:
Add AngularJS section

This section outlines style guidelines that can't really be enforced by
eslint, but would encourage consistency throughout our codebase.

Other changes:
  - Updated all examples to be internally consistent with our style guide
    - 4-space indentation
    - function isolation
    - etc.

named function expressions).

title: Multiline comma-dangle on functions?
body:
Hi, this rule appears to enforce incorrect syntax for functions. Tell me I'm wrong.

https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/style.js#L47

Example:

```
foo(
  'hello',
  'goodbye',
);
```

That passes listing with airbnb-base, but is broken syntax on execution:

```
);
^
SyntaxError: Unexpected token )
    at createScript (vm.js:56:10)
    at Object.runInThisContext (vm.js:97:10)
    at Module._compile (module.js:542:28)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:579:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:487:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:446:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:438:3)
    at Module.runMain (module.js:604:10)
    at run (bootstrap_node.js:390:7)
    at startup (bootstrap_node.js:150:9)
```

Changing that line to `functions: 'ignore',` appears to fix the issue.
